alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 08 at 3:01PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Rapid Spread of Wildfire Is Possible Monday Evening and again Tuesday Afternoon... .A strong cold front will bring a surge of very dry air and strong northwesterly winds this Monday evening, beginning across the Brush Country and Rio Grande Plains shortly after sunset and spreading across much of the rest of the Rio Grande Valley and Deep South Texas by mid to late evening. Relative humidity will crash into the teens and lower 20s during the evening before rising back into the 20s overnight as temperatures fall. Winds will diminish a bit on Tuesday, but still remain strong enough to combine with continued dry air to return relative humidity below 20 percent by early afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY FOR THE COMBINATION OF LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS, AND DRYING FUELS, FOR ALL OF THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND DEEP SOUTH TEXAS EXCEPT THE BARRIER ISLAND... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning for the combination of very low humidity, strong northwest winds, and drying fuels which is in effect from 8 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...All of the Rio Grande Valley and Deep South Texas Except the Barrier Island. * TIMING...8 PM tonight through 6 PM Tuesday. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph this evening and perhaps overnight...then northwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 30 mph on Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent this evening and again Tuesday afternoon. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 69. * LIGHTNING...None. * IMPACTS...Rapid spread of wildfire on drying grasses and brush is likely Monday evening and again Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
